text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Jordanian press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Prime Minister Kabariti says "no devaluation of the dinar under any circumstance and the private sector and the government are in one trench...and our ties with Iraq are balanced."
- King Hussein and Syrian President Hafez Assad review the developments in the peace process and Arab situation.
- Central Bank foreign currency deposits deregulation frees $700 million of deposits back to the banking system, says a Central Bank official.
- Brother kills sister in the city of Mafrak.
- Jordan's ambassador to Israel arrives on Tuesday.

- Kabariti emphasises the importance of resuming the peace process, President Arafat's senior aide says "we are keen to see a continuation of the Jordanian custodianship of the Moslem holy sites in Jerusalem."
- Information Minister says Israeli President Weizman's visit to Jordan ceremonial.
- Information Minister Muasher says the civilian infiltrator who was shot by Israel this week was heading to the Jordanian border.
- Palestinian Authority requests Jordan to continue its role in Arab East Jerusalem.
